intro: Erigeron ovinus, commonly known as the woolly fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant features soft, hairy foliage that gives it its common name, and it produces daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Erigeron ovinus is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
